medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours before presentation, initially diffuse abdominal pain that gradually migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The pain became unremitting and progressive prompting the patient to seek emergency care. Accompanied by nausea without vomiting and no fevers. Normal bowel movements were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hyperlipidemia 2. Hypothyroidism 3. Herniated disc 4. History of pericarditis 5. Hemorrhoids, asymptomatic. Past surgical history includes: 1. Aortic valve replacement with porcine valve 2. Laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father and sister with colon polyps.
